total_subquestions_ys: Q1: Identify the locations of the number 1 in the input grid.
Q2: For each location of 1, check if it is surrounded by 8s in the input grid.
Q3: If a location of 1 is surrounded by 8s, change the surrounding 8s to 1s in the output grid.
Q4: For each location of 1, check if it is surrounded by 1s in the output grid.

Q7: If a location of 1 is surrounded by 3s, change the 1 to 2 in the output grid.
Q8: For each location of 1, check if it is surrounded by 1s and 3s in the output grid.
Q9: If a location of 1 is surrounded by 1s and 3s, change the surrounding 1s to 3s in the output grid.

Q14: For each location of 1, check if it is surrounded by 3s in the output grid.
Q15: If a location of 1 is surrounded by 3s, change the 1 to 2 in the output grid.

Q1: Identify the locations of the number 1 in the input grid.
Q2: For each location of 1, check if there are any other 1s in the same row or column.
Q3: If there are other 1s in the same row or column, mark the cells between them as 3.
Q4: If there are no other 1s in the same row or column, mark the cells in the same row or column as 1.
Q5: For the cells that are not marked as 1 or 3, mark them as 2 if they are adjacent to a cell marked as 1, otherwise mark them as the original number.
select_new_ys: Q1: Identify the locations of the number 1 in the input grid.
Q2: For each location of 1, check if there are any other 1s in the same row or column.

Q4: If there are no other 1s in the same row or column, mark the cells in the same row or column as 1.
Q5: For the cells that are not marked as 1 or 3, mark them as 2 if they are adjacent to a cell marked as 1, otherwise mark them as the original number.
